alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Coastal Nassau; Eastern Alachua; Trout River; Western Alachua; Western Duval; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 3:11PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL NASSAU...BRADFORD... ALACHUA...CLAY AND DUVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EST... At 311 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Maxville to 7 miles west of Archer. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Gainesville, Orange Park, Starke, Keystone Heights, Arlington, Melrose, Unf, Mandarin, and Middleburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Jacksonville. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northern and northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Coastal Nassau; Eastern Alachua; Trout River; Western Alachua; Western Duval; Western Marion
